ratings.comment: Xiaoqin stands out as one of the best instructors I have had at this university. Unlike many other mathematics instructors, Xiaoqin tries to help you understand the mathematical concepts on an intuitive level before delving deep into the nitty gritty details. His grading scheme is tough but fair for a 600 level class. He is truly one of a kind!

While lectures were nicely organized, the exams were much harder than examples given in lecture or discussion. You need to do the hw & go to discussion to understand but even though I thought I had a good understanding of the material the exams were very difficult. If you have never taken calc before, this will probably be really hard..

He's really a nice guy. He wants the class to get good grades. 431 with Guo is no harder than any calc class here. Would definitely recommend him. He prepared me for math 632 very well. He follows the textbook closely, which is really nice because you can use it to help clarify everything that is discussed in class.

He was a nice guy that obviously cared a lot about math, but he wasn't the best at teaching it. I would try to pay attention in lecture, but he would often skip around and make it more confusing. In the final exam I taught myself most of the topics and learned more than I did in actual class.

He's not the best professor, but he's pretty nice. Since I took calc in high school, not much was new, although the new material half of it I learned in class, and half of it I had to learn by myself. Pretty accessible for help.

Alright contrary to what most of these reviews say how the professor is a nice guy and all. I'm going to give you a review from someone who isn't good at math and who doesn't care about how nice a prof. is. If you can find another professor do so, this one does not speak good English during lectures and often times rushes through concepts.

Great guy, tough class. Learned most of the concepts independently but if you show up to lecture and are attentive then it will definitely help. The material makes more sense the more resources you consult to prepare to spend lots of time working for this class.

This professor was extremely nice, but was terrible at teaching calc. I struggled to understand what was happening in class and often left lecture feeling more confused than I already was when I originally arrived. I had no calc experience before this class, and had to teach myself a lot of the concepts, which was extremely time consuming.

Xiaoquin is a great professor! He comes to class every day with a smile on his face and he wants to make sure that everyone clearly understands the course material. I had taken Calculus before this course, and I still found parts to be challenging, so if you're new to calculus I would consider choosing someone else.

His lectures are very easy to follow (if you give your attention to him all the time) and he explained every single detail about any method/theorem that he introduced. Homeworks are assigned every lecture day and they are supposed to make your understanding better, so I totally understand the load.

Professor Guo really does care about his students' success. But his lectures are sometimes hard to follow and I spent a lot of time outside of class trying to figure out what was going on in class. If you haven't taken a calculus class in the past, I do not recommend taking this class.

Xiaoqin is a nice guy and always upbeat, and he's generally neat and easy to follow. He moves and writes quick, but is very detailed and thorough in his explanation. Math 211 isn't a bad course, but if you're not a Calculus person then definitely seek outside help and don't fall behind.

This is a man who will stop his lecture to say "bless you" to a sneezing student in a class of several hundred kids. The guy wears flannel every other day and is always rocking a pair of Jesus sandals. He is not always perfectly understandable, but for the most part his lectures are good. Hope to grab a beer with him after the semester final.

Xiaoqin is a really sweet and awesome guy, he really tries his best to answer the student's questions during lectures; and if he can't, he asks them to stay after class or see him during his office hours so he can help them understand better. Sometimes lecture can be a little boring because how it drags on and its, well, math.

Xiaoqin is an awesome dude. He truly cares and wants to teach, but nobody ever asks questions in class, so I can understand why people say his lectures are bad. Sometimes he is hard to understand, but it's never that bad. The bottom line is I learned all of the material and it was generally easy, and I credit that to Xiaoqin.

Xiaoqin was a pretty disappointing professor for me. His lectures were repetitive and he often did long proofs for no reason. His communication was pretty bad, and a lot of times it was hard to understand him in class. I think he tried and cared about our success but all of my learning was done in discussion, not in his lectures.

He is a nice guy and willing to help. His lectures were repetitive and sometimes went over information we did not need to know. The exams were all really easy, but the grading criteria for the overall grade was somewhat confusing because of how the class was curved.

Prof Guo is the kindest soul. He is genuinely happy to teach those who are willing to work. He sometimes has difficulty understanding questions students ask but makes sure he answers them! Really cares about your success.
